member.summary: The has the ability to watch a data file on disk and automatically refresh the engine as soon as the file is updated. This setting enables/disables that feature.
member.remarks: The AutoUpdate feature must also be enabled in order for the file system watcher to work. If the engine is built from a byte[] then this setting does nothing.

member.name: M:FiftyOne.Pipeline.Engines.Configuration.DataFileConfigurationBuilderBase`2.SetUpdatePollingInterval(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the time between checks for a new data file made by the . Default = 30 minutes.
member.remarks: Generally, the will not check for a new data file until the 'expected update time' that is stored in the current data file. This interval is the time to wait between checks after that time if no update is initially found. If automatic updates are disabled then this setting does nothing.
member.param: The number of seconds between checks.

member.param: The time between checks.

member.summary: Configure the data file to update on startup or not.

member.name: M:FiftyOne.Pipeline.Engines.Configuration.DataFileConfigurationBuilderBase`2.Build(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called to indicate that configuration of this file is complete and the user can continue to configure the engine that the data file will be used by.
member.param: The path to the data file location. If a relative path is supplied then the location is determined as relative to the current working directory as supplied by . Whether the path is relative or absolute, if there is no file at the specified location then, before starting processing, the engine will download the latest version of the file using the configured auto-update settings.
If true then the engine will make a temporary copy of the data file for its own use. This allows the original to be updated while the engine continues processing.

Constructor

The name of the property. Must match the string key used to store the property value in the instance.
The type of the property values.
The category the property belongs to.
A list of the data tiers that can be used to determine values for this property.
True if the property is available in the results for the associated , false otherwise.
Full description of the property.
The meta-data for properties that are stored in sub-items. Only relevant if this meta-data instance relates to a collection of complex objects.
Only relevant if `Type` is . Defaults to false. If set to true then the JavaScript in this property will not be executed automatically on the client device.

The names of any properties that, when executed, will obtain additional evidence that can help in determining the value of this property. Note that these names should include any parts after the element data key. I.e. if the complete property name is 'devices.profiles.screenwidthpixelsjavascript' then the name in this list must be 'profiles.screenwidthpixelsjavascript'

member.name: T:FiftyOne.Pipeline.Engines.PerformanceProfiles
member.summary: The performance profiles to use with the SetPerformanceProfile method.

member.name: F:FiftyOne.Pipeline.Engines.PerformanceProfiles.LowMemory
member.summary: Use as little memory as possible. Performance can be significantly impacted but will still be fast enough for many scenarios. Similar to HighPerformance and Balanced but uses much smaller cache sizes. The precise details will vary based on the implementation of the engine.

member.name: F:FiftyOne.Pipeline.Engines.PerformanceProfiles.MaxPerformance
member.summary: Best possible performance. Everything loaded into memory. Execution can be optimized to ignore operations relating to maintaining caches, etc. The precise details will vary based on the implementation of the engine.

member.name: F:FiftyOne.Pipeline.Engines.PerformanceProfiles.HighPerformance
member.summary: Load smaller data structures into memory. Larger data structures are cached to keep the most frequently used data in memory as well. Similar to Balanced but uses larger cache sizes. The precise details will vary based on the implementation of the engine.

member.name: F:FiftyOne.Pipeline.Engines.PerformanceProfiles.Balanced
member.summary: Load smaller data structures into memory. Larger data structures are cached to keep the most frequently used data in memory as well. Similar to HighPerformance but uses smaller cache sizes. The precise details will vary based on the implementation of the engine.

member.name: F:FiftyOne.Pipeline.Engines.PerformanceProfiles.BalancedTemp
member.summary: The precise details will vary based on the implementation of the engine.

member.name: M:FiftyOne.Pipeline.Engines.FlowElements.SingleFileAspectEngineBuilderBase`2.Build(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Build an engine using the current options and the specified data file. Also registers the data file with the data update service.
member.param: The path to the data file location. If a relative path is supplied then the location is determined as relative to the current working directory as supplied by . Whether the path is relative or absolute, if there is no file at the specified location then, before starting processing, the engine will download the latest version of the file using the configured auto-update settings.

If true, the engine will create a copy of the data file in a temporary location rather than using the file provided directly. If not loading all data into memory, this is required for automatic data updates to occur.

member.name: M:FiftyOne.Pipeline.Engines.FlowElements.SingleFileAspectEngineBuilderBase`2.SetDataFileSystemWatcher(System.Boolean)
member.summary: The has the ability to watch a data file on disk and automatically refresh the engine as soon as the file is updated. This setting enables/disables that feature.
member.remarks: The AutoUpdate feature must also be enabled in order for the file system watcher to work. If the engine is built from a byte[] then this setting does nothing.
member.param: The cache configuration to use.

member.name: M:FiftyOne.Pipeline.Engines.FlowElements.SingleFileAspectEngineBuilderBase`2.SetUpdatePollingInterval(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the time between checks for a new data file made by the . Default = 30 minutes.
member.remarks: Generally, the will not check for a new data file until the 'expected update time' that is stored in the current data file. This interval is the time to wait between checks after that time if no update is initially found. If automatic updates are disabled then this setting does nothing.
member.param: The number of seconds between checks.

member.name: M:FiftyOne.Pipeline.Engines.FlowElements.SingleFileAspectEngineBuilderBase`2.SetUpdatePollingInterval(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Set the time between checks for a new data file made by the . Default = 30 minutes.
member.remarks: Generally, the will not check for a new data file until the 'expected update time' that is stored in the current data file. member.param: The time between checks.

member.name: F:FiftyOne.Pipeline.Engines.Services.MissingPropertyReason.PropertyExcludedFromEngineConfiguration
member.summary: The property was not included in the list of properties that were passed in when the engine was created. Restricting the list of properties that you want an engine to populate can result in improved performance. However, if you then request a property that is not in that list then it will not be populated.

member.name: F:FiftyOne.Pipeline.Engines.Services.MissingPropertyReason.PropertyNotAccessibleWithResourceKey
member.summary: 51Degrees cloud engines use a 'resourceKey' to determine the properties that should be returned in the response. This reason indicates that the resource key probably does not include the requested property. A new resource key will need to be created that does include the property before you will be able to access it.

member.name: F:FiftyOne.Pipeline.Engines.Services.MissingPropertyReason.ProductNotAccessibleWithResourceKey
member.summary: 51Degrees cloud engines use a 'resourceKey' to determine the properties that should be returned in the response. This reason indicates that the resource key does not include any properties for the requested engine. A new resource key will need to be created that does include the property before you will be able to access it.

member.name: T:FiftyOne.Pipeline.Engines.Trackers.ITracker

summary.para: Represents a 'tracker'. A tracker is a data structure that stores meta-data relating to a key derived from a given instance. This meta-data is used to determine if the should continue to be processed or not.
The details of key creation and the specifics of the meta-data are determined by the tracker implementation.

member.remarks: As an example, a tracker could create a key using the source IP address from the evidence and use the associated meta-data to store a count of the number of times a given source IP has been seen.

member.name: M:FiftyOne.Pipeline.Engines.Trackers.ITracker.Track(FiftyOne.Pipeline.Core.Data.IFlowData)
member.summary: Track the specified instance. If the key created from the data does not yet exist in the tracker then it will be added. If it does already exist then the meta-data will be updated according to the tracker implementation's logic.
member.param: The to track.
member.returns: True if further processing is allowed by the tracker's logic. False otherwise.

member.name: T:FiftyOne.Pipeline.Engines.Trackers.TrackerBase`1
member.summary: The abstract base class for trackers. A tracker is a data structure that stores meta-data relating to a key derived from a given instance. The details of key creation and the specifics of the meta-data are determined by the tracker implementation. The key will always be a instance as defined by . The meta-data can be any type and is specified using the generic type parameter TValue.
member.remarks: As an example, a tracker could create a key using the source IP address from the evidence and use the associated meta-data to store a count of the number of times a given source IP has been seen.
member.typeparam: The type of the meta-data object that the tracker stores with each key value.

member.param: The that has matched an existing entry in the tracker.
The meta-data instance that the tracker holds for the key generated from the data.

member.name: M:FiftyOne.Pipeline.Engines.Trackers.TrackerBase`1.Track(FiftyOne.Pipeline.Core.Data.IFlowData)
member.summary: Track the specified instance. If the key created from the data does not yet exist in the tracker then it will be added. If it does already exist then the meta-data will be updated according to the tracker implementation's logic.
member.param: The to track.
